item.title: Live Updates: Stocks in Asia and Europe Plunge as Trump Says Tariffs Will Stay
item.description: U.S. markets were also set to open lower after President Trump said that he would not back off his trade war, reinforcing fears of a global economic d...

item.title: Europe Is Ready to Make Its First Countermove to Trump Tariffs
item.description: European Union officials will vet and vote on a list of retaliatory tariffs this week, while contemplating what comes next.

item.title: China Tries to Downplay the Trade War’s Effects on Its Economy
item.description: Faced with economic disruption, Beijing is presenting itself as too powerful to succumb to U.S. pressure. It is also censoring criticism at home.

item.title: Ukraine Questions Value of Black Sea Truce With Russia
item.description: Ukrainian Navy officers and business owners in the port city pondered what Kyiv could gain from a truce after it pushed back Russian vessels and resum...

item.title: What We Know About the Case of Gaza Aid Workers Killed by Israeli Gunfire
item.description: The Israeli military, confronted with video evidence contradicting its initial account, now says it was “mistaken.”
